page.title: 18LIFE-STYLES
page.content: We visited an Old People's Home which was built in 1968 and modernised more recently.It has 24 bedrooms, 17 of which are occupied individually by 4 men and 13 women.In the morning the staff bring everyone a cup of tea at 7a.m.and they all get up for breakfast at 8.30a.m. Lunch is at 12.30p.m. (which is earlier than we have it), followed by a cup of tea at 3p.m.and high tea at 5p.m.The Home is in a beautiful house, which used to be a hotel.Some of the old ladies who were talking to us showed us their own bedrooms and we were struck by the lovely furniture they each had. Most of the people we met were over 80 and one of the men was blind. They cannot keep their own pets but there were small birds and tanks of fish about the building. They always enjoy seeing visitors.
